messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] unschooling college-aged kids
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 09/17/02 7:09:32 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ncfarms@aloha.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 09/17/02 7:09:32 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
ncfarms@... writes:

<< I have a plethora of webpages bookmarked regarding alternatives to the
usual college route. My son, Sky, is college-aged but not wanting that
route at this time. If there is any interest, I would be happy to go
through them and post the website addresses - but unless folks are into it,
I really don't want to do that work!
Let me know . . . there are soooooooo many ways up the mountain for 'older'
unschoolers. >>

Lee,
I have a daughter in the same situation as your son, Sky. College is out
there, maybe, just not right now. We would certainly be interested in
resources to explore if you wouldn't mind sharing even just a few. Thanks!

Leonore

messages.subject: unschooling college-aged kids
messages.msgSnippet: Aloha dear listmates- I have a plethora of webpages bookmarked regarding alternatives to the usual college route. My son, Sky, is college-aged but not wanting
messages.messageBody:
Aloha dear listmates-
I have a plethora of webpages bookmarked regarding alternatives to the
usual college route. My son, Sky, is college-aged but not wanting that
route at this time. If there is any interest, I would be happy to go
through them and post the website addresses - but unless folks are into it,
I really don't want to do that work!
Let me know . . . there are soooooooo many ways up the mountain for 'older'
unschoolers.
Love, Lee
